intro: Cyphostemma mandrakense, commonly known as the African moonvine, is a climbing plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Rhamnaceae and is characterized by its woody stems and compound leaves. The plant produces small, greenish-yellow flowers that are followed by elongated, fleshy fruits. It is often found in rocky habitats and is adapted to arid conditions. Due to its unique appearance and ecological role, it is of interest to botanists and conservationists.
